comment: Do not take this professor unless it's your only option. His lectures are more like failed stand-up routines and he will often have you drive to class for him to just say one thing and then have everyone leave rather than posting online. But if you don't show up you'll get deducted 5 points from your final grade. Also groupwork every class!!!

Don't take Arnett unless you are prepared to for an insane amount of work. The amount of group projects and outside work required for this class is insane. I got a B and I'm usually an all A student. He's one of the toughest graders I have ever experienced. His criteria is so arbitrary and his class made the entire semester way more stressful.

Dr. Arnett is a really great teacher. He was organized and very clear with what he wanted with each assignment. Still, his class is difficult and requires a lot of work. The research paper was particularly hard so don't wait until the last minute to do it.

This class was very challenging especially if you take the hybrid course. DO NOT take the hybrid course. There is a lot of reading and quizzes online over the reading, some are easy some are not. There are online attendance grades, they count! Participation counts especially peer-critiques. He's a great teacher if you want a challenge if not don't.

Dr. Arnett is awesome. He is passionate about his work and does his best to get his students passionate as well. He'll help you all you need, but you've got to ask. If you're not willing to help yourself, you'll get nothing from him. He's a good guy and truly cares about his students and educating them.

I know most people don't like him, and I can sort of see why (he frustrated me sometimes, too), but overall, he's really knowledgeable, and he makes class fun. He's a huge geek, but I like that about him. If you're not into the subject or aren't good with writing, I would suggest avoiding him. Otherwise, he's pretty cool :)

Dr. Arnett seems to have a vendetta against students.  This is my third C in over 100 hours of classes.  He has quizzes due on the same day as major assignments.  Very poorly organized due dates.  His grading is some of the strictest I have encountered and it doesn't help the student to learn.  The group projects will make/break your grade.

Required peer ratings; promised ratings will factor into grades but really uses his own bias. Grading rubric is broken. Failure to account for peer reviews. Failure to respond/account for the lack of work presented by peers in group despite a detailed MEMO notifying him of the problem. I feel the mandatory 4-person group robbed me of my great GPA.

This guy is ridiculous. He answers questions with well Yes and No. He knows a lot about technical writing, but he grades way too hard. I felt it impossible to get an A on anything in his class. I was going to get a C so I withdrew before penalty. Took it online this semester and got an A+. All 98s and 95s. Apparently he is doing something wrong...

I was actually pleasantly surprised with this professor. Instructions were clear and good feedback was given if you followed his format. The main drawback is the constant work required, do not take this class on a full schedule or you will be easily overwhelmed, especially near the end of the semester. I wish he taught some CS courses.

If you can avoid this professor please do. I have never felt as degraded by a professor as I have with him. The assignments are as useless as his teaching methods & his feedback is very unclear. He took off points for not capitalizing 2 letters in the file name for an assignment.I spend more time worrying about capital letters than learning.

This professor is kinda of a Trekkie. Nice guy, and tries to be helpful. He responds quickly to email. I found his assignments to be pretty difficult towards the end. There is athis group project at the end - choose your team wisely and you must be near perfect to get a good grade. I got a B and I had to check up on it every day.

I wrote the comment below.  about him only knowing memos, technical letters, etc.  I meant to set his easiness at a 1, but accidentally set it on 4 thinking that was harder. My bad.  Yea he's a pain. Take the fully online version instead any day.

He knows how to type Memos, technical letters, and symbols. None of which are used in the world-wide tech job I am at. His assignments are all require peer comments.  He screws everyone over with due dates. Sunday from 3 pm to midnight? Friday from class til midnight? etc. He does not extend dates. No reasons for grades given. Check GAView 3x a day

This professor is hard. If you are not interested in the subject, then, you have no business taking his class. He will talk to you after class, in his office, and by email. He's mostly clear in his instruction. Although, you may need to research some things on the internet. However, his grades may not be as clear. Be sure to remember your mistakes.
One of the hardest graders I've ever had. Answers questions with no, yes, & maybe. Terrible sense of humor. Don't take him unless it is a required class and he is the only class open
Answers all questions with "Yes and No, depends on how you write it." He grades hard and doesn't explain what he took points off of. I do not suggest this professor.

Difficult class, but if you make the effort you will learn so much about rhetorical writing. He is a tough grader. If you get an A, you have definitely earned it. Very fair, extremely helpful and a very dry, but great, sense of humor. Don't take Dr. Arnett looking to skate by. I enjoyed him very much and would take his class again.

Dr. Arnett is really good at what he teaches he expects alot from his students and he is a hard grader he makes you earn your grades but willing to help when you need it he responds to emails in a resonable amount of time and he has a really good sense of humor I would probably get an F if he was grading this comment :)

Unless you are planning on being a copy editor, do not take this class with Dr. Arnett. He is very unclear about what he expects as answers, but very picky about what you give him. His tests are some of the hardest that I have ever taken. Most of the class never actually had time to finish one of his tests. Got a B in his class and I was lucky.

Funny and helpful one on one. His tests are bears, though.He goes through material really fast and it's up to you to catch on. He gives good feedback, but is a tough grader. Be prepared to work hard for an A.

The material of the class is interesting, but he could be so boring sometimes. He is knowledgable about the material and cares about the students, but expects a lot out of you. Not an easy A, but possible.

If you are interested in CREATIVE editing, do not take this class with him. He teaches technical editing which I did not like. He can be strict but he is willing to work with you and has fair expectations of a junior level class. He's got quite a sense of humor.
